briefTitle: Feasibility of Cardiac Rehabilitation in Patients With Heart Failure at the Moi Teaching and Referral Hospital
officialTitle: Feasibility of Cardiac Rehabilitation in Patients With Heart Failure at the Moi Teaching and Referral Hospital

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

1. New York Heart Association (NYHA) Class II and III heart failure
2. Have had an echocardiographic study in the past 5 years
3. Owns a mobile telephone
4. Can participate in exercise
5. Can read/ primary care giver can read in English or Kiswahili
6. Can travel to hospital three times a week

Exclusion Criteria:

1. Recent acute illness requiring hospitalization or initiation of new medication in the preceding 4 weeks
2. Limitation of activity because of factors other than fatigue or exertional dyspnea, such as arthritis, claudication in the legs, angina, advanced comorbidities
3. Known arrhythmia
4. Heart failure due to congenital heart disease
5. Pregnant patients as may be confirmed by patient report or urine pregnancy tests
6. Heart failure due to obstructive cardiomyopathy including mitral stenosis and aortic stenosis
7. Presence of implanted pacemaker

primary.description: Mean adherence of at least 25% to the exercise prescriptions

secondary.measure: Change in 6 minute walk time distance (in meters)
Change in Depression screen score using patient health questionnaire 9 (PHQ9)
secondary.description: Screen score based on patient health questionnaire 9 (PHQ9)

secondary.measure: Change in Quality of life using short form health survey (SF 36) score
secondary.description: Quality of life based on short form health survey (SF 36) score

secondary.measure: Qualitative assessment of perceptions towards cardiac rehabilitation from focus group discussions
secondary.description: Thematic analysis of barriers and incentives towards cardiac rehabilitation
